intro: Hieracium forficulatum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and can reach heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough, toothed edge, while its flowers are clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium forficulatum is known for its ability to spread rapidly through rhizomes, making it an invasive species in some regions.
